headline: Amazon upgraded, Adobe downgraded: Wall Street’s top analyst calls
summary: The most talked about and market moving research calls around Wall Street are now in one place. Here are today’s research calls that investors need to know, as compiled by The Fly. Top 5 Upgrades: Wells Fargo upgraded Amazon.com (AMZN) to Overweight from Equal Weight with a price target of $280, up from $245. Following its cloud market and Anthropic contribution analysis, Wells has increased conviction that Amazon Web Services will see revenue acceleration. Morgan Stanley upgraded ServiceNow (NO

headline: Motorola Solutions’ ‘Inform’ Unifies Real-Time Incident Response and Security Operations
summary: CHICAGO, September 25, 2025--At GSX 2025 in New Orleans, Sept. 29 - Oct. 1, Motorola Solutions (NYSE: MSI) is showcasing new AI-assisted incident response solutions across on-premise, cloud-based and other third-party security deployments that ease the burden on security operators managing hundreds of cameras, doors, sensors and more.

headline: Axon Is Outgrowing Its Critics And That's Why It's A Clear Buy For Me
summary: Axon Enterprise's Q2 2025 revenue rose 33% YoY to $669 million, with SaaS revenue up 39% and management raising 2025 guidance to $2.65-$2.73 billion. Learn more about AXON stock here.
